Module mesakit.graph.core
Package com.telenav.mesakit.graph.identifiers

Class EdgeIdentifier

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.value.identifier.Identifier
com.telenav.mesakit.graph.identifiers.EdgeIdentifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.model.Identifiable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Zeroable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.value.LongValued, GraphElementIdentifier, Comparable<com.telenav.kivakit.core.value.identifier.Identifier>
Direct Known Subclasses:
WorldEdgeIdentifier
public class EdgeIdentifier extends com.telenav.kivakit.core.value.identifier.Identifier implements GraphElementIdentifier
An identifier of Edges in a Graph that can be used to retrieve the identified edge with Graph.edgeForIdentifier(EdgeIdentifier). Edge identifiers can be forward (positive sign) or reverse (negative sign). This can be determined with isForward() and isReverse(). The forward identifier can be retrieved for any edge identifier with asForward(). The edge identifier in the opposite direction can be retrieved with reversed(), which changes the sign from positive to negative or negative to positive. In certain applications, it may be desirable to retrieve this identifier without the wrapper object. This can be achieved with GraphElement.identifierAsLong().

Edge identifiers have a numeric scheme that adds edge-specific information to an underlying PbfWayIdentifier, which is a kind of MapIdentifier in the original source data. The method asWayIdentifier() can be used to extract the PbfWayIdentifier from the edge identifier. asDirectionalWayIdentifier() provides the same identifier, but with a negative sign if the edge identifier is negative.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

  • Field Details

    • SIZE_IN_BITS

      public static final int SIZE_IN_BITS
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INVALID

      public static final EdgeIdentifier INVALID

    • MAXIMUM_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

      public static final long MAXIMUM_SEQUENCE_NUMBER
      The low 6 decimal digits of each edge identifier are reserved for sequence numbers produced when ways are split into edges by clean cutting and edge sectioning. This scheme preserves the way identifier in the digits above the bottom 6 digits while allowing each edge to have a unique identifier. 
       IIIIIIIIII SSSSSS

 I = way identifier
 S = 6 digit sequence number
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SEQUENCE_NUMBER_SHIFT

      public static final long SEQUENCE_NUMBER_SHIFT
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SEQUENCE_NUMBER_EDGE_SECTION_INCREMENT

      public static final long SEQUENCE_NUMBER_EDGE_SECTION_INCREMENT
      The sequence number for an edge increases by this increment for each edge section within a given clean-cut chunk. 
       IIIIIIIIII CC EEEE

 I = way identifier
 C = chunk number
 E = edge section number
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • edgeIdentifierSwitchParser

      public static com.telenav.kivakit.commandline.SwitchParser.Builder<EdgeIdentifier> edgeIdentifierSwitchParser(com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener listener, String name, String description)

    • identifierToWayIdentifier

      public static long identifierToWayIdentifier(long elementIdentifier)
      Returns the way identifier for the given element identifier. This is obtained by shifting the element identifier six decimal places to the right, removing the sequence number that was added to the way identifier.

    • asDirectionalWayIdentifier

      public MapWayIdentifier asDirectionalWayIdentifier()
      Returns a directional PBF way identifier for this edge identifier (by stripping off the low 4 digits)

    • asForward

      public EdgeIdentifier asForward()
      Returns this edge as a forward (positive) edge identifier (if it isn't already). If the edge is a reversed identifier (negative value), the corresponding positive edge identifier is returned.

    • asWayIdentifier

      public PbfWayIdentifier asWayIdentifier()
      Returns a way identifier for this edge identifier

    • element

    • isForward

      public boolean isForward()
      Returns true if this edge identifier is for a forward edge

    • isReverse

      public boolean isReverse()
      Returns true if this edge identifier is for a reversed edge (a negative identifier)

    • next

      public EdgeIdentifier next()
      Returns the next identifier after this one

    • nextChunk

      public EdgeIdentifier nextChunk()
      Returns the next identifier after this one

    • reversed

      public EdgeIdentifier reversed()
      Returns an edge identifier in the opposite direction. If this edge identifier is forward (positive identifier), the reverse identifier will be returned (negative identifier). If the edge identifier is reverse (negative identifier), the forward identifier will be returned (positive identifier).

    • sequenceNumber

      public int sequenceNumber()
      Returns the sequence number of this edge identifier. For example, the sequence number of edge 1234 000 003 is 3.

    • sequenceNumbered

      public EdgeIdentifier sequenceNumbered()
      Returns this identifier with room for sequence numbers. For example, identifier 1234 becomes 1234 000 000

    • unqualified

      public EdgeIdentifier unqualified()

    • withSequenceNumber

      public EdgeIdentifier withSequenceNumber(int sequenceNumber)
      Returns this number with the given sequence number. For example, identifier 12340003 with sequence number 7 becomes 12340007
